entries.meaning: (rail transport) The metal plate which forms the base platform of a steam locomotive and supports the boiler and the driver's cab, particularly in the United Kingdom.
The engineer's cab in any kind of train.
examples: Kit had fallen into conversation with a footplate man who was deadheading back out to Samarkand, where he lived with his wife and children.

entries.meaning: (anatomy) The flat portion at the base of the stapes; pedicel.
examples: The footplate of the stapes develops and ossifies in conjunction with the otic capsule and thus takes its origin from the otic placode in the embryo.

entries.meaning: The part of a roller skate that attaches to the boot.
(construction) A timber in a wood frame that distributes a concentrated load.
(auto parts) A platform on which the driver's foot rests but which, unlike a pedal, has no effect.

verbs.description: footplate (third-person singular simple present footplates, present participle footplating, simple past and past participle footplated)

entries.meaning: (rail transport) To travel (or work) on the footplate of a locomotive.
